classes.name: ChannelManager
classes.description:
Manages channels with fetch and send.
Extends Collection so you can use .get(), .set(), .filter(), etc.

methods.name: fetch

params.name: channelId
params.description: Snowflake of the channel

methods.description: Fetch a channel by ID from the API (or return from cache if present).
examples:
const channel = await client.channels.fetch(channelId);
if (channel?.isSendable()) await channel.send('Hello!');

methods.name: fetchMessage

params.name: channelId
params.description: Snowflake of the channel

params.name: messageId
params.description: Snowflake of the message

methods.description: Fetch a message by ID from the API.
examples:
const channel = await client.channels.resolve(channelId);
const message = await channel?.messages?.fetch(messageId);

methods.name: resolve

params.name: channelId
params.description: Snowflake of the channel

methods.description:
Get a channel from cache or fetch from the API if not present.
Convenience helper to avoid repeating `client.channels.get(id) ?? (await client.channels.fetch(id))`.
examples:
const channel = await client.channels.resolve(message.channelId);
if (channel?.isSendable()) await channel.send('Hello!');

methods.name: send

params.name: channelId
params.description: Snowflake of the channel (text channel or DM)

params.name: payload
params.description: Text content or object with content, embeds, and/or files

methods.description:
Send a message to a channel by ID. Works even when the channel is not cached.
Skips the fetch when you only need to send.

properties.description: Timestamp when the client became ready. Null until READY is received.

properties.name: Routes
properties.type: { readonly channel: (id: Snowflake) => `/channels/${string}`; readonly channelMessages: (id: Snowflake) => `/channels/${string}/messages`; ... 55 more ...; reado...

properties.name: user
properties.description: The authenticated bot user. Null until READY is received.

properties.name: ws
properties.description: WebSocket manager. Throws if not logged in.

Fetch instance info (API URL, gateway URL, features). GET /instance.

examples:

Get or create a User from API data. Caches in client.users.
Updates existing user's username, avatar, etc. when fresh data is provided.

Resolve an emoji argument to the API format (unicode or "name:id").

classes.name: Collection
classes.description:
Extended Map with utility methods for key-value collections.
Similar to discord.js Collection.

methods.name: clone
methods.description: Creates an identical shallow copy of this collection.

methods.name: concat
methods.description: Combines this collection with others into a new collection.

methods.name: every
methods.description: Tests whether all elements pass the test implemented by the provided function.

methods.name: filter
methods.description: Creates a new collection with all elements that pass the test implemented by the provided function.

methods.name: find
methods.description: Searches for a single item where the given function returns a truthy value.

methods.name: findKey
methods.description: Returns the key of the first item where the given function returns a truthy value.

methods.name: first
methods.description: Obtains the first value(s) in this collection.

methods.name: last
methods.description: Obtains the last value(s) in this collection.

methods.name: map
methods.description: Creates a new array with the results of calling the provided function on every element.

methods.name: partition
methods.description: Partitions the collection into two collections: one that passes the predicate and one that fails.

methods.name: random
methods.description: Returns a random value from this collection.

methods.name: reduce

params.name: fn
params.type: (accumulator: T, value: V, key: K) => T

methods.description: Applies a function against an accumulator and each element to reduce the collection to a single value.

methods.name: some
methods.description: Tests whether at least one element passes the test implemented by the provided function.

methods.name: sort

params.name: compareFn
params.type: (a: V, b: V, aKey: K, bKey: K) => number

methods.description: Sorts the collection in place and returns it.

methods.name: tap
methods.description: Invokes the given function and returns this collection (for chaining).

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Returns an array of the values in this collection.

methods.name: toString
methods.description: Returns a string representation of the collection (array of values).

classes.name: GuildManager
classes.description:
Manages guilds with fetch.
Extends Collection so you can use .get(), .set(), .filter(), etc.

methods.name: create

params.name: options
params.type: { name: string; icon?: string | null; empty_features?: boolean; }
params.description: name (required), icon (base64), empty_features

methods.description: Create a guild. POST /guilds.

methods.name: fetch

params.name: guildId
params.description: Snowflake of the guild

methods.description: Fetch a guild by ID from the API (or return from cache if present).
examples:
const guild = await client.guilds.fetch(guildId);
if (guild) console.log(guild.name);

methods.name: resolve

params.name: guildId
params.description: Snowflake of the guild

methods.description:
Get a guild from cache or fetch from the API if not present.
Convenience helper to avoid repeating `client.guilds.get(id) ?? (await client.guilds.fetch(id))`.
examples:
const guild = await client.guilds.resolve(message.guildId);
if (guild) console.log(guild.name);

classes.name: GuildMember
classes.description: Represents a member of a guild.

params.name: data
params.description: API guild member from GET /guilds/{id}/members or GET /guilds/{id}/members/{user_id}

properties.name: displayName
properties.description: Nickname, or global name, or username.

properties.name: permissions
properties.description:
Get the member's guild-level permissions (from roles only, no channel overwrites).
Use this for server-wide permission checks (e.g. ban, kick, manage roles).
examples:
const perms = member.permissions;
if (perms.has(PermissionFlags.BanMembers)) { ... }

properties.name: roles
properties.description: Role manager with add/remove/set and cache. Discord.js parity: member.roles.add(), member.roles.cache

methods.name: addRole

params.name: roleId
params.description:
The role ID to add
Requires Manage Roles permission.

methods.description:
Add a role to this member.
Prefer member.roles.add(roleId) for Discord.js parity.

methods.name: avatarURL
methods.description:
Get the guild-specific avatar URL for this member.
Returns null if the member has no guild avatar (use displayAvatarURL for fallback).

methods.name: bannerURL
methods.description:
Get the guild-specific banner URL for this member.
Returns null if the member has no guild banner.

methods.name: displayAvatarURL
methods.description:
Get the avatar URL to display for this member.
Uses guild-specific avatar if set, otherwise falls back to the user's avatar.

methods.name: edit

params.name: options
params.type: { nick?: string | null; roles?: string[]; avatar?: string | null; banner?: string | null; bio?: string | null; pronouns?: string | null; accent_color?: number | null; profile_flags?: number | null; ... 5 more ...; connection_id?: string | null; }

methods.description:
Edit this guild member. PATCH /guilds/{id}/members/{userId} or /members/@me for the bot.
For @me: nick, avatar, banner, bio, pronouns, accent_color, profile_flags, mute, deaf,
communication_disabled_until, timeout_reason, channel_id, connection_id.
For other members: same plus roles (array of role IDs).

methods.name: permissionsIn

params.name: channel
params.description: The guild channel to check permissions for

methods.description:
Compute the member's effective permissions in a guild channel.
Applies role permissions and channel overwrites.
examples:
const perms = member.permissionsIn(channel);
if (perms.has(PermissionFlags.SendMessages)) { ... }

methods.name: removeRole

params.name: roleId
params.description:
The role ID to remove
Requires Manage Roles permission.

methods.description:
Remove a role from this member.
Prefer member.roles.remove(roleId) for Discord.js parity.

classes.name: GuildMemberManager
classes.description:
Manages guild members with a Collection-like API.
Extends Collection so you can use .get(), .set(), .filter(), etc.
Provides guild.members.me for Discord.js parity.

properties.name: me
properties.description:
The current bot user as a GuildMember in this guild.
Returns null if the bot's member is not cached or client.user is null.
Use fetchMe() to load the bot's member when not cached.
examples:
const perms = guild.members.me?.permissions;
if (perms?.has(PermissionFlags.BanMembers)) { ... }

methods.name: fetch

File handling for multipart requests. Matches fluxer_api parseMultipartMessageData exactly:

- files[N]: File parts where N is 0-based index (fluxer API expects files[0], files[1], etc.)

properties.description: Used as filename when filename is not set (required)

interfaces.name: BitFieldResolvable
interfaces.description:
Data structure that allows efficient storage of multiple flags (bits) in a single number.

Note: JavaScript bitwise operations (|, &, ^, <<, >>) operate on 32-bit signed integers.
Flags with values exceeding 2^30 may exhibit unexpected behavior. For permission-style
bitfields with more than 30 bits, consider using BigInt-based implementations.

enums.name: PermissionFlags
enums.description:
Permission flags aligned with Fluxer API (fluxer_api/src/constants/Channel.ts).

Administrator (bit 3) implies all permissions. Guild owner bypasses role computation.
